ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Hello I am new
ygData.msgSnippet: I actually enjoy playing a cleric. It can be rough sometimes because I often need alot of help. Soloing just isn t practical. I have to rely on others alot.
ygData.messageBody:
I actually enjoy playing a cleric. It can be rough sometimes because I often
need alot of help. Soloing just isn't practical. I have to rely on others
alot. But others rely on my healing skills and sometimes my ability to stun
a mob. It feels good to be the one keeping the group alive.
luv,
-Su

Agreed. If your guild "needs another cleric" why not? Skill can be made up
for more easily than you think. My halfie cleric was PLed to 10 via
quests...CB belts, Krag chick talons and bone chips...by 12 her skills were
as good as anyone else's. This was pre-changes and it made life a lot
easier. Unfortunately, clerics are boring, and STAY boring.
----- Original Message -----
From: mlockridge01
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, April 30, 2002 12:19 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] Re: Hello I am new


I agree as far as not pl on first characters. Important game skills
are aquired through solo and group leveling.

PL is valuable for some alternate characters. How many times must one
spend endless hours killing spiders? If your plan for your alt is
more than just experiencing EQ from a different class perspective, pl
can be a legitimate gaming tool.

Barto Proudfoot

--- In EverQuest@y..., "Orion" <orionv@m...> wrote:
> Don't be afraid to ask someone to pl you?? Sorry I do not agree
with that. Do not ask for pl....do it yourself. Being power leveled
makes for bad players with low skills. Do it yourself with
groups,etc....
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Charles Clavey
> To: EverQuest@y...

> items, but you should. also, dont be afraid to ask

> Regards
> Charles Clavey
